org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf
Class DefaultJMFMessageFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.JMFMessageFactory
      org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.DefaultJMFMessageFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
TemplateJMFMessageFactory
public class DefaultJMFMessageFactory
extends JMFMessageFactory

A default implementation of JMFMessageFactory. This implementation creates JDF elements using the constructor of com.heidelberg.JDFLib.core.JDFDoc: 

 new JDFDoc(elementName).getRoot()

Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)
See Also:
com.heidelberg.JDFLib.core.JDFDoc

createJMF

public org.cip4.jdflib.jmf.JDFJMF createJMF()
Convenience method for creating JMF nodes. This method sets the attributes:
  • JMF/@xmlns="http://www.CIP4.org/JDFSchema_1_1"
  • JMF/@xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  • JMF/@Version="1.2"
  • JMF/@TimeStamp
  • JMF/@SenderID

Specified by:
createJMF in class JMFMessageFactory
Returns:
a JMF node

createJMF

public org.cip4.jdflib.jmf.JDFJMF createJMF(java.lang.String xsiType)
Description copied from class: JMFMessageFactory
Creates a JMF message based on the specified template name. An implementation could for example use xsi:type as the template name.

Specified by:
createJMF in class JMFMessageFactory
Parameters:
xsiType - an identifier for the type of message to create
Returns:
See Also:
Specification 1.2, Table 5-2, xsi:type
